newsitem.title: USA: International Network IPO soars 84 pct.
newsitem.headline: International Network IPO soars 84 pct.

text.p: Shares of International Network Services skyrocketed after their market debut on Wednesday, climbing 84 percent and surprising IPO analysts after several months of lackluster offerings.

Shares rose 13-1/2 to 29-1/2 from their IPO price of $16 each. The 2.5 million shares were priced above the estimated pricing range of $12-$14, which had been revised higher from an initial estimated range of $9-$11.
Analysts cheered the high-flying IPO, which beat even the rosiest predictions. It was one of the first IPOs in months to price above range and soar higher at its market debut.

"International Network is a very good company with a great future, although it's still not justified at this price," said Shah. He added Cisco Systems Inc's 8.3 percent stake in International was also contributing to the gains.
"This company will probably be acquired by another large player, and Cisco is the leading contender becasue of its 8.3 percent stake," he said.

International Network provides services for complex enterprise networks. It has 435 employees in 17 cities and its clients include AT&T Corp, Ascend Communications Inc, Georgia-Pacific Corp and Sprint Corp.
The company posted profits of $1.7 million on revenues of $44.1 million for the fiscal year ended June 30, 1996. For the prior year, it posted a loss of $108,000 on revenues of $15.5 million.
"We're back, and we're back big," said Manish Shah of the IPO Maven, who expects the IPO to signal the beginning of a host of strong IPOs coming this month.
